articles.title: Completely agree with your points.
articles.content: Completely agree with your points. The problem I faced is that depending on your organization, once you get into leadership you are not expected to code. If you want to keep your technical skills, you have to do so as extra work outside work hours, which is less than ideal ...

articles.title: Thank you, Apple. Your iOS update just cost me 10 bucks
articles.content: Some months ago I retired my planned-obsolence-ridden iPhone 6 and got a Google Pixel with Project Fi * to replace it — and I’m loving it. To avoid degrading the Pixel’s battery through many charging cycles, I had the brilliant idea to keep my old iPhone 6 for GPS navigation ...

articles.title: Hi David,
articles.content: Hi David, We luckily haven’t had to deal with many legacy systems, but the few times we had to we tried to get at least a couple of people ramped up on it — even if it’s scheduled to be decommissioned. The rationale is that we try to cover the ...

articles.title: Hi, Doug. I enjoyed your article. Just a couple of clarifications:
articles.content: Hi, Doug. I enjoyed your article. Just a couple of clarifications: Expedia is not an aggregator/meta-search, it is an OTA itself. Meta-search engines are sites like skyscanner, hipmunk, trivago and kayak to mention some. At the beginning of the article you make the distinction between OTAs and meta-search engines but ...

articles.title: From Engineer to Manager: keeping your technical skills
articles.content: I became an Engineering Manager over two years ago. One of my main challenges during this time has been to find the balance between my leadership duties towards my team and my desire to keep coding. I figured I must not be the only one struggling with this, so I ...

articles.title: Unexpected learnings from the CIA leak
articles.content: Today WikiLeaks published the Vault 7 CIA leak. The leak is a dump of over 7,500 internal CIA Confluence pages which include documentation of their tools, how-to guides, best practices and more. Instead of discussing the (im)morality of the CIA not disclosing the exploits they use on Android, iOS and ...

articles.title: Hey Jeremy, I would love to get your feedback on the small library we created to build integration…
articles.content: Hey Jeremy, I would love to get your feedback on the small library we created to build integration tests for Alexa Skills, in a similar to what you describe in your post: https://medium.com/@gamell/conversational-integration-tests-for-your-alexa-skills-node-js-f685eb6be088#.1npekdydv Thanks!

articles.title: Conversational Integration Tests for your Alexa Skills (Node/JS)
articles.content: Expedia released the first version of our Alexa Skill last December at the AWS re:Invent event. Since then, a team of developers in the San Francisco and Bellevue offices have been hard at work adding features, refactoring and modernizing the code to adopt the new Amazon JS SDK. The main ...

articles.title: In some markets like Singapore the recruiter will ask you by default “current salary?”
articles.content: In some markets like Singapore the recruiter will ask you by default “current salary?” in the first screening interview and refuse to go forward if you don’t provide that info.
